reviews.text: We stayed in the same room as we had done a few years before and it was just as nice. The hotel is comfortable and decorated nicely. The food was good and plenty, with appertisers and canapes. Staff were helpful and courteous.
reviews.title: As good as before

reviews.text: We would definitely stay here again
reviews.title: Cosy stay with lovely food

reviews.text: We have just returned from a relaxing stay at the bay tree. The hotel has a country period feel to it - just the sort of thing you would expect from this area. We were upgraded on arrival to a garden room which was clean and comfortable. It was perhaps a little chintz for my tastes but most importantly a comfy bed and nice bathroom with deep bath and Molton Brown products which is a nice touch. My only real compliant was the position of the TV in relation to the bed ie you couldn't see it from the bed so it was quite awkward if you wanted to watch anything.
reviews.title: Warm, friendly and charming - a beautiful wedding experience
warm, cosy, comfortable hotel
reviews.text: We ate in the restaurant which has flagstone floors and tapestries on the wall. Food was fab - we had a three course meal but complimentary canapes, breads and an appetizer were also included so by the end we were both totally stuffed. The service was excellent and staff were friendly both at reception and in the restaurant. What we liked particularly about the hotel is that it has a relaxed feel to it. Just off the dining room is a library area with comfy chairs, a big open fire and a selection of board games - we sat there whilst we finished our wine and drank coffee and could quite happily have fallen asleep!

reviews.title: Excellent Value two night break.

reviews.text: The Bar food and the breakfasts were excellent , our only niggle being with the salt which was granular....... the standard of the hotel does really demand Malden salt !!!!
reviews.title: Wonderful

reviews.text: Stayed at the Bay Tree hotel for family wedding. For £160 per night (which was meant to be a cheap rate for the wedding guests, but normal price is £165!) we were expecting comfort with a bit of luxury - however, on check in we were very disappointed and would only expect to pay maximum £100 for the standard of this hotel. But I suppose they can charge whatever they like in the Cotswolds!
reviews.title: Musty, moldy room, unaccomodating

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Whilst the actual venue is picturesque and ideal for a summer wedding, the actual accommodation does not live up to expectation.
reviews.title: A Perfect recipe for romantic bliss!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had a lovely stay at this hotel. It is warm, cosy and comfortable. On arrival we were given a complimentary upgrade, to a junior suite, which had a huge four poster bed. The room was nice and clean. The bathroom was big and again clean. We loved the added luxury of Molton Brown toiletries. The hotel itself is an old coaching Inn and had lovely fire places in the public rooms.
reviews.title: Cosy Country Hotel

reviews.text: Dinner was excellent, with additional 'amuse bouche' given by the chef, all of which were excellent. Service in the restaurant was also very good, attentive and friendly staff. The staff in the hotel were also very nice and friendly and welcoming, so we were surprised at the negative reviews.
reviews.title: Winter Wedding at The Bay Tree

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had our wedding reception at the Bay Tree in January and were really happy with the hotel. We had good service from Maureen in the run-up to the big day and plenty of support from the on-the-day staff who made everything run effortlessly. With the snow etc everything ran really late but somehow they managed to catch up during the meal meaning the entertainment and evening guests' arrival worked perfectly.
reviews.title: A fabulous hotel.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A couple of slight negatives: the wedding suite en suite doesn't have a proper shower with screen etc, which made getting ready difficult. Also when we left the day after we were over-charged on our final bill, although to their credit they couldn't explain the total and didn't make a fuss about us paying there and then - the correct bill came through a couple of weeks later.
reviews.title: An excellent hotel in a lovely location
